trustfund:
TF029286-PHRD - HEALTH PROFESSIONALS
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF030338-SINGAPORE CTF FY03 - GENERAL,TF030357-AUSTRALIA CTF FY03 - INDONESIA,TF040882-INDONESIA: FIFTH HEALTH PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The ID-Fifth Health Project for
            Indonesia had the following ratings: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was unlikely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that future health projects should
            be more carefully designed to reflect the actual incentives
            and/or lack of incentives that exist in the public health
            system. Absence of a carefully developed monitoring and
            evaluation framework and plan can seriously compromise
            project implementation. For the Fifth Health project (HPV),
            the possibility of using block grants to support innovative
            initiatives by local governments became a valuable feature
            of the Project following a major decentralization of
            healthcare delivery functions to the district level.
